docs.snippet: Florida State's Jameis Winston completed his busiest seven-day stretch of the spring last week, playing four baseball games and participating in four football practices. The Heisman winner didn't have his best days on the diamond, but coach Jimbo ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Florida State's Jameis Winston completed his busiest seven-day stretch of the spring last week, playing four baseball games and participating in four football practices. The Heisman winner didn't have his best days on the diamond, but coach Jimbo Fisher said he made strides on the football field.

headline.main: Heisman Winner Winston Struggles During Busy Week
headline.print_headline: Heisman Winner Winston Struggles During Busy Week

docs.snippet: The president, Mark Emmert, and organization officials said an overhaul would look to give the power conferences the autonomy to provide some things athletes in a unionization effort are seeking....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president, Mark Emmert, and organization officials said an overhaul would look to give the power conferences the autonomy to provide some things athletes in a unionization effort are seeking.
docs.abstract: NCAA expects its membership to approve a template for overhaul that would give athletes at least some of the benefits they are seeking in hopes of staving off the union effort; basic idea is to give autonomy to the five so-called power conferences in college athletics, allowing them to provide additional benefits to their athletes.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Planning to Address Benefits for Some of Its Players, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Planning to Address Benefits for Some of Its Players, Officials Say

docs.snippet: A recent report found spending on sports is outpacing educational expenditures not only in Division I, the most competitive level, but in small institutions and community colleges....
docs.lead_paragraph: A recent report found spending on sports is outpacing educational expenditures not only in Division I, the most competitive level, but in small institutions and community colleges.
docs.abstract: American Association of University Professors report finds spending on sports is outpacing educational expenditures at colleges not only in competitive Division I level, but in smaller institutions and community colleges as well.

headline.main: Colleges Increasing Spending on Sports Faster Than on Academics, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Colleges Increasing Spending on Sports Faster Than on Academics, Report Finds
